de.jannlab.core

Class CellFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.jannlab.core.CellFunction

  • public final class CellFunction
extends Object
    This class contains static methods for computing the activations and derivations for serveral types of activation functions. These are unary functions for computing just single values and more complex functions for computing the activation for a range cells. For such a function an argument array and a result array with offsets are given.

    Author:
    Sebastian Otte

      • exp

        public static double exp(double value)
        This is just a exp-wrapper method. In this method the exp-function can be replaced by a fast approx. version of exp.

        Parameters:
        value - The exponent.
        Returns:
        The exponentiation of e^{value}.

      • id

        public static void id(double[] data,
      int dataoffset,
      double[] result,
      int resultoffset,
      int size)
        Applies the identification function (copy) on a given memory block.

        Parameters:
        data - Refers the source array containing the function arguments.
        dataoffset - Gives the lower bound for the argument values.
        result - Refers the destination array where the function results will be stored in.
        resultoffset - Give the lower bound for the result values.
        size - Gives the number of arguments.

      • perform

        public static void perform(double[] data,
           int dataoffset,
           double[] result,
           int resultoffset,
           int size,
           int function)
        Applies the function given by an index on a given memory block. The methods uses a switch block to map to the specific activation function.

        Parameters:
        data - Refers the source array containing the function arguments.
        dataoffset - Gives the lower bound for the argument values.
        result - Refers the destination array where the function results will be stored in.
        resultoffset - Give the lower bound for the result values.
        size - Gives the number of arguments.
        function - Determines the specific activation function.
